ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: John and Mary Evelyn are very approachable, their online lectures are very well organized, and the readings were extremely insightful, especially those by Swearer.

Really enjoyed the whole course! The combination of canvas assignments and in-class meetings allowed for a really thorough understanding of the materials, and the weekly discussions were always interesting!
It's such a great class that I couldn't say what is the "best". But if I have to, I would say it's the professors that encourage and inspire me a lot both in academics and my life.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: The timing of the "flipped course" format is tough. With class not until late on Wednesday, I hate that I have to have all the readings and postings done by the preceding weekend. By the time class rolls around, the material is no longer fresh in my mind. I also hate to get too far ahead and mix up course materials, so I don't move to the next module until after class. That leaves me with only a couple days each week where I can realistically do the work, leaving me feeling crammed and rushed every weekend.
Don't really think there's much that needs to be improved, I've taken a few of the religion & ecology courses over my time here and I think the structure is great.
There was too much material covered in a very short time, and many in the class had backgrounds (personally or academically) with the religions, which made it hard to keep up

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: The discussion may be organized more carefully due to the limited time.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I have found what I am truely interested in owing to the class.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I didn't know anything about South Asian religions.

I've been taking Prof. Tucker and Grim's courses for a few years now and they've always been some of the best parts of my academic semester! You learn so much and the classroom environment is always wonderful to be part of.
To deepen my understanding of religion and ecology intersection
I thought I would be interested in the theme.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Please communicate more with the professors and you will learn a lot.
